commit_message:
Set Monasca Java tempests to run with mod_wsgi

Monasca Java API does not support Keystone deployment with uwsgi at the
moment. This change as the temporary solution switches the Java tempest
to run with WSGI_MODE="mod_wsgi".

Additionally:

* added filter to run 'uwsgi' Java tests only on master
* removed filters for stable/mitaka where EOL has alredy been reached

Change-Id: I363bef8599674de79c48c392db9aa5840b6324fc

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-15 09:09:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/cf5f76adc0274c5d2e67fa345c122b32bdc4d584', 'message': "Default snmp to less verbose logging

Currently we just use what puppet-snmp provides in terms of defaults.
This means that currently every single snmp query gets logged with
the following:
May 15 10:51:30 centos.localdomain snmpd[5159]: Connection from UDP: [127.0.0.1]:57799->[127.0.0.1]:161
May 15 10:51:30 centos.localdomain snmpd[5159]: Connection from UDP: [127.0.0.1]:57799->[127.0.0.1]:161
May 15 10:51:32 centos.localdomain snmpd[5159]: Connection from UDP: [127.0.0.1]:50566->[127.0.0.1]:161

The reason is that we use '-LS0-6d' as the default content for
/etc/sysconfig/snmpd:
https://github.com/razorsedge/puppet-snmp/blob/master/manifests/params.pp#L322

This default means that we are logging from 0 (LOG_EMERG) to 6
(LOG_INFO). The above messages bring nothing in a default installation
and only spam the log files, so let's lower the upper log level to 5
(LOG_NOTICE) by default, so we properly do not see every single query in
the logs. We add an option so the operator can still configure the
desired log level via a Heat parameter.

Change-Id: I8d3dfdb4d549cd27131346fc477755ad72313449

commit_message:
Default snmp to less verbose logging

Currently we just use what puppet-snmp provides in terms of defaults.
This means that currently every single snmp query gets logged with
the following:
May 15 10:51:30 centos.localdomain snmpd[5159]: Connection from UDP: [127.0.0.1]:57799->[127.0.0.1]:161
May 15 10:51:30 centos.localdomain snmpd[5159]: Connection from UDP: [127.0.0.1]:57799->[127.0.0.1]:161
May 15 10:51:32 centos.localdomain snmpd[5159]: Connection from UDP: [127.0.0.1]:50566->[127.0.0.1]:161

The reason is that we use '-LS0-6d' as the default content for
/etc/sysconfig/snmpd:
https://github.com/razorsedge/puppet-snmp/blob/master/manifests/params.pp#L322

This default means that we are logging from 0 (LOG_EMERG) to 6
(LOG_INFO). The above messages bring nothing in a default installation
and only spam the log files, so let's lower the upper log level to 5
(LOG_NOTICE) by default, so we properly do not see every single query in
the logs. We add an option so the operator can still configure the
desired log level via a Heat parameter.

Change-Id: I8d3dfdb4d549cd27131346fc477755ad72313449
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/79/464579/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Blacklist python 3 UT because of eventlet bug

Eventlet>=0.21.0 has been blocked in uc [1] due to bug [2].
Let's re-block failed py3 UT based on eventlet 0.21.0 until
new release lands.

[1]. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/464687/
[2]. https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/401

Change-Id: I5b68731519bc7de1273ef9d397ed908be63db64e

commit_message:
Refactor db model methods

* This is a preparation for optimizing API layer. We need to
  get rid of redundant data coversions like "db model -> dict ->
  REST resource". We can do directly "db model -> REST resource".
  To do that, db models need to have a method that returns
  column values w/o creating a dictionary.

Change-Id: I89c78fdce256249286903c4e2c8bef2a5bf63af7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/01/465001/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/94/465894/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Nova instances live migration ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Nova is capable of live migration instances from one host to a different host to support various operational tasks including: * Host Maintenance * Host capacity management * Resizing and moving instances to better hardware Nova configuration drive implication ------------------------------------ Depending on the OpenStack-Ansible version in use, Nova can be configured to force configuration drive attachments to instances. In this case, a ISO9660 CD-ROM image will be made available to the instance via the ``/mnt`` mount point. This can be used by tools, such as cloud-init, to gain access to instance metadata. This is an alternative way of accessing the Nova EC2-style Metadata. To allow live migration of Nova instances, this forced provisioning of the config (CD-ROM) drive needs either be turned off, or the format of the configuration drive needs to be changed to a disk format like vfat, a format which both Linux and Windows instances can access. This work around is required for all Libvirt versions prior 1.2.17. To turn off the forced provisioning of the config drive, add the following override to the ``/etc/openstack_deploy/user_variables.yml`` file: .. code-block:: yaml nova_force_config_drive: False To change the format of the configuration drive, to a hard disk style format, use the following configuration inside the same ``/etc/openstack_deploy/user_variables.yml`` file: .. code-block:: yaml nova_nova_conf_overrides: DEFAULT: config_drive_format: vfat force_config_drive: false Tunneling versus direct transport --------------------------------- In the default configuration, Nova determines the correct transport URL for how to transfer the data from one host to the other. Depending on the ``nova_virt_type`` override the following configurations are used: * kvm defaults to ``qemu+tcp://%s/system`` * qemu defaults to ``qemu+tcp://%s/system`` * xen defaults to ``xenmigr://%s/system`` Libvirt TCP port to transfer the data to migrate. OpenStack-Ansible changes the default setting and used a encrypted SSH connection to transfer the instance data. .. code-block:: yaml live_migration_uri = "qemu+ssh://nova@%s/system?no_verify=1&keyfile={{ nova_system_home_folder }}/.ssh/id_rsa" Other configurations can be configured inside the ``/etc/openstack_deploy/user_variables.yml`` file: .. code-block:: yaml nova_nova_conf_overrides: libvirt: live_migration_completion_timeout: 0 live_migration_progress_timeout: 0 live_migration_uri: "qemu+ssh://nova@%s/system?keyfile=/var/lib/nova/.ssh/id_rsa&no_verify=1" Local versus shared storage --------------------------- By default, live migration assumes that your Nova instances are stored on shared storage and KVM/Libvirt only need to synchronize the memory and base image of the Nova instance to the new host. Live migrations on local storage will fail as a result of that assumption. Migrations with local storage can be accomplished by allowing instance disk migrations with the ``--block-migrate`` option. Additional Nova flavor features like ephemeral storage or swap have an impact on live migration performance and success. Cinder attached volumes also require a Libvirt version larger or equal to 1.2.17. Executing the migration ----------------------- The live migration is accessible via the nova client. .. code-block:: console nova live-migration [--block-migrate] [--force] <uuid> [<host>] Examplarery live migration on a local storage: .. code-block:: console nova live-migration --block-migrate <uuid of the instance> <nova host> Monitoring the status --------------------- Once the live migration request has been accepted, the status can be monitored with the nova client: .. code-block:: console nova migration-list +-----+------------+-----------+----------------+--------------+-----------+-----------+---------------+------------+------------+------------+------------+-----------------+ | Id | Source Node | Dest Node | Source Compute | Dest Compute | Dest Host | Status | Instance UUID | Old Flavor | New Flavor | Created At | Updated At | Type | +----+-------------+-----------+----------------+--------------+-----------+-----------+---------------+------------+------------+------------+------------+-----------------+ | 6 | - | - | compute01 | compute02 | - | preparing | f95ee17a-d09c | 7 | 7 | date | date | live-migration | +----+-------------+-----------+----------------+--------------+-----------+-----------+---------------+------------+------------+------------+------------+-----------------+ To filter the list, the options ``--host`` or ``--status`` can be used: .. code-block:: console nova migration-list --status error In cases where the live migration fails, both the source and destination compute nodes need to be checked for errors. Usually it is sufficient to search for the instance UUID only to find errors related to the live migration. Other forms of instance migration --------------------------------- Besides the live migration, Nova offers the option to migrate entire hosts in a online (live) or offline (cold) migration. The following nova client commands are provided: * ``host-evacuate-live`` Live migrate all instances of the specified host to other hosts if resource utilzation allows. It is best to use shared storage like Ceph or NFS for host evacuation. * ``host-servers-migrate`` This command is similar to host evacuation but migrates all instances off the specified host while they are shutdown. * ``resize`` Changes the flavor of an Nova instance (increase) while rebooting and also migrates (cold) the instance to a new host to accommodate the new resource requirements. This operation can take considerate amount of time, depending disk image sizes.

commit_message:
Add missing rootwrap filter for cryptsetup

This change restores the rootwrap filter for cryptsetup that was
recently removed by I37ffc90c0bd57029fced251b5cfd7cd4318a0292 from
compute.filters, as it is still needed by dmcrypt.  Without the rootwrap
filter, `cryptsetup` is not authorized to run with root permissions.

Change-Id: I5fe3e5d5e5a9694d0dbe5b59248e5eaf89858c62
Closes-Bug: #1688166

commit_message:
Add NodeCreateBatchSize parameter

This uses the heat resource group batched create feature to ensure
we don't create more than 30 nodes at a time, which has been reported
as the maximum supported by the default ironic ipxe/TFTP configuration.

Change-Id: If3651e4c465d8d7bd4c8f2b48d45b1272ff2d272

subject: Add Composite Ring Functionality
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-06 12:27:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/b1f032f10e624513a0373c09d747dc04983a3682', 'message': 'Draft implementation of Composite Ring Zipper

This is another implementation for Composite Ring (related-change)
to enable better dispersion for global erasure coded cluster.

The most significant difference from the related-change is that this
solution attempt to solve the problem as an offline tool rather than
dynamic compositing on the running servers. Due to the change, we gains
the merrits like as:

- Less code and being simple
- No complex state validation on the running server
- Easy deployments with an offline tool

Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>

 build a composite ring from a number of component ring builders.

* Enables metadata to be included in RingData and serialized to
  ring.gz file. This is used to persist metadata of the composite
  ring.

* Add id to RingBuilder to differentiate rings in composite.
  A RingBuilder now gets a UUID when it is saved to file if
  it does not already have one. RingBuilders loaded from
  file do NOT get a UUID assigned unless it was persisted in
  the file. This forces users to explicitly assign an id to
  existing ring builders by saving the state back to file.

  The UUID is included in first line of the output from:

    swift-ring-builder <builder-file>

commit_message:
Add Composite Ring Functionality

* Adds a composite_builder module which provides the functionality to
  build a composite ring from a number of component ring builders.

* Add id to RingBuilder to differentiate rings in composite.
  A RingBuilder now gets a UUID when it is saved to file if
  it does not already have one. A RingBuilder loaded from
  file does NOT get a UUID assigned unless it was previously persisted in
  the file. This forces users to explicitly assign an id to
  existing ring builders by saving the state back to file.

  The UUID is included in first line of the output from:

    swift-ring-builder <builder-file>

Background:

This is another implementation for Composite Ring [1]
to enable better dispersion for global erasure coded cluster.

The most significant difference from the related-change [1] is that this
solution attempts to solve the problem as an offline tool rather than
dynamic compositing on the running servers. Due to the change, we gain
advantages such as:

- Less code and being simple
- No complex state validation on the running server
- Easy deployments with an offline tool

This patch does not provide a command line utility for managing
composite rings. The interface for such a tool is still under
discussion; this patch provides the enabling functionality first.

Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Alistair Coles <alistairncoles@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I0d8928b55020592f8e75321d1f7678688301d797
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/21/441921/20 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Remove --cell_name, --tenant options
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-17 11:19:30.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/v2/shell.py', 'releasenotes/notes/remove-deprecated-option-in-9.0.0-bc76629d28f1d4c4.yaml', 'novaclient/tests/unit/v2/test_shell.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient/commit/16434fa1164aafdaec3780b871216647940594e1', 'message': 'Remove --cell_name, --tenant options

These are both deprecated with at least one release and can be removed
now.

Change-Id: Id68380bc82622bb2405181a68b85239eb2343d0a
'}]
commit_message:
Remove --cell_name, --tenant options

These are both deprecated with at least one release and can be removed
now.

Change-Id: Id68380bc82622bb2405181a68b85239eb2343d0a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/09/465509/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: def test_flavor_access_list_bad_filter(self): cmd = 'flavor-access-list --flavor 2 --tenant proj2' _out, err = self.run_command(cmd) # assert the deprecation warning for using --tenant self.assertIn('WARNING: Option "--tenant" is deprecated', err) self.run_command('migration-list --host host1 --cell_name child1 ' '--status finished')

subject: Move OVB settings to tripleo-quickstart-extras
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-22 22:06:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/commit/fad93d79da4ade1f7f506e14455a8a3d09a578dc', 'message': 'WIP: Move OVB settings to tripleo-quickstart-extras

The OVB settings were kept in an internal repo.
Since settings for public clouds can be added to
the extras repo, where open settings can be used,
access to private repos should not be needed.

Note that the user will still have to source a rc
file to access resources on a tenant.

Change-Id: Id625c2a60811fafb353519ad9bf976fc7bdea826

commit_message:
Move OVB settings to tripleo-quickstart-extras

The OVB settings were kept in an internal repo.
Since settings for public clouds can be added to
the extras repo, where open settings can be used,
access to private repos should not be needed.

Note that the user will still have to source a rc
file to access resources on a tenant.

Change-Id: Id625c2a60811fafb353519ad9bf976fc7bdea826

commit_message:
Docker service for neutron-metadata

Also create a neutron_metadata named volume to store neutron shared
state and mount it in /var/lib/neutron in relevant containers.

commit_message:
Ensure consistent path for multinode upgrade job

Some changes in t-h-t recently mean we've got to support multinode
scenario environments that reference j2 rendered files, but this
only works when the environment is contained within the --templates
tree.  So we copy the environment under test to the "new" tree
during an upgrade test, and ensure all paths reference the new
location.

Change-Id: I0288c2b470606d990281f6c37071b632a2d0d423
Closes-Bug: #1687908

commit_message:
Update plan creation command

This patch updates the create plan command to use the latest
changes to the workflows in tripleo-common that allow a
deployment plan to be created or updated from a git
repository.

Partially-Implements: blueprint git-deployment-plan
Change-Id: I71c1f5d58abcf0a55598f02fbd21fdffedcf5291

added_lines: """Create a deployment plan - container - source_url: null - queue_name: tripleo - generate_passwords: true - use_default_templates: false """ '--use-default-templates', action='store_true', default=True, help=_('Use default heat templates.') ) parser.add_argument( parser.add_argument('--source-url', '-s', metavar='<SOURCE_URL>', type=str, help=_('Git repository url')) if parsed_args.templates: use_default_templates = False source_url = parsed_args.source_url plan_management.create_deployment_plan( generate_passwords=generate_passwords, source_url=source_url, use_default_templates=use_default_templates)

subject: Add SESSION_SHORT_TIMEOUT setting
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-26 15:26:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/7fb0a3edd67aef21a42baaf7965ef91fb736ced3', 'message': "Add SESSION_SHORT_TIMEOUT setting

This is a new setting included to support the 'Remember Me' checkbox.

I know what you're thinking:  Why add a _SHORT_TIMEOUT setting
to replace the old value rather than a new _LONG_TIMEOUT setting
with a new value?  It's because Horizon middleware also
uses the SESSION_TIMEOUT value -- we need the middleware to have
the long value (the now-extended SESSION_TIMEOUT) or else
it aborts sessions prematurely despite the longer timeout
set in django_openstack_auth.  In addition, this should
make for gentler backports to earlier horizon versions.

Change-Id: I2ed27ed001de94fa4c27cc30a40b457e3d670461
Depends-On: 390891
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-26 15:26:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/8c9239e2b1233db1d776eef351c12e5906934bcd', 'message': "Add SESSION_SHORT_TIMEOUT setting

This is a new setting included to support the 'Remember Me' checkbox.

I know what you're thinking:  Why add a _SHORT_TIMEOUT setting
to replace the old value rather than a new _LONG_TIMEOUT setting
with a new value?  It's because Horizon middleware also
uses the SESSION_TIMEOUT value -- we need the middleware to have
the long value (the now-extended SESSION_TIMEOUT) or else
it aborts sessions prematurely despite the longer timeout
set in django_openstack_auth.  In addition, this should
make for gentler backports to earlier horizon versions.

commit_message:
Add SESSION_SHORT_TIMEOUT setting

This is a new setting included to support the 'Remember Me' checkbox.

I know what you're thinking:  Why add a _SHORT_TIMEOUT setting
to replace the old value rather than a new _LONG_TIMEOUT setting
with a new value?  It's because Horizon middleware also
uses the SESSION_TIMEOUT value -- we need the middleware to have
the long value (the now-extended SESSION_TIMEOUT) or else
it aborts sessions prematurely despite the longer timeout
set in django_openstack_auth.  In addition, this should
make for gentler backports to earlier horizon versions.

Depends-On: I30e1f16ff2c1d76f2615cbcf792e1d7b830b9668
Change-Id: I2ed27ed001de94fa4c27cc30a40b457e3d670461
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/93/390893/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # minutes, a value of 1800 will log users out after 30 minutes. # # SESSION_SHORT_TIMEOUT is used for session length on unknown browsers, # as indicated by a user not checking 'remember me' in the login UI. SESSION_SHORT_TIMEOUT = 3600 SESSION_TIMEOUT = 86400
deleted_lines: # minutes, a value of 1800 will log users out after 30 minutes SESSION_TIMEOUT = 3600

commit_message:
Make API calls in Instances view parallel

In order to increase rendering speed, make
api.nova.server_list, api.network.servers_update_addresses,
api.nova.flavor_list and api.glance.image_list_detailed
parallel. For admin panel also api.keystone.tenant_list
is parallelized.

Closes-bug: #1655307

Change-Id: I83150d3963f1233edc9efbcdac299520dedbed3c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/11/447111/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import futurist instances = [] full_flavors = {} image_map = {} def _task_get_instances(): # Gather our instances try: tmp_instances, self._more = api.nova.server_list( self.request, search_opts=search_opts) instances.extend(tmp_instances) except Exception: exceptions.handle(self.request, _('Unable to retrieve instances.')) # In case of exception when calling nova.server_list # don't call api.network return def _task_get_flavors(): # Gather our flavors to correlate our instances to them try: flavors = api.nova.flavor_list(self.request) full_flavors.update([(str(flavor.id), flavor) for flavor in flavors]) except Exception: exceptions.handle(self.request, ignore=True) def _task_get_images(): # Gather our images to correlate our instances to them try: # TODO(gabriel): Handle pagination. images = api.glance.image_list_detailed(self.request)[0] image_map.update([(str(image.id), image) for image in images]) except Exception: exceptions.handle(self.request, ignore=True) with futurist.ThreadPoolExecutor(max_workers=3) as e: e.submit(fn=_task_get_instances) e.submit(fn=_task_get_flavors) e.submit(fn=_task_get_images) # Loop through instances to get flavor info. for instance in instances: if hasattr(instance, 'image'): # Instance from image returns dict if isinstance(instance.image, dict): if instance.image.get('id') in image_map: instance.image = image_map[instance.image.get('id')] # In case image not found in image_map, set name to empty # to avoid fallback API call to Glance in api/nova.py # until the call is deprecated in api itself else: instance.image['name'] = _("-") try: flavor_id = instance.flavor["id"] if flavor_id in full_flavors: instance.full_flavor = full_flavors[flavor_id] else: # If the flavor_id is not in full_flavors list, # get it via nova api. instance.full_flavor = api.nova.flavor_get( self.request, flavor_id) except Exception: msg = ('Unable to retrieve flavor "%s" for instance "%s".' % (flavor_id, instance.id)) LOG.info(msg)
deleted_lines: instances = [] # Gather our flavors and images and correlate our instances to them try: flavors = api.nova.flavor_list(self.request) except Exception: flavors = [] exceptions.handle(self.request, ignore=True) try: # TODO(gabriel): Handle pagination. images = api.glance.image_list_detailed(self.request)[0] except Exception: images = [] exceptions.handle(self.request, ignore=True) if 'image_name' in search_opts and \ not swap_filter(images, search_opts, 'image_name', 'image'): return instances elif 'flavor_name' in search_opts and \ not swap_filter(flavors, search_opts, 'flavor_name', 'flavor'): self._more = False return instances # Gather our instances try: instances, self._more = api.nova.server_list( self.request, search_opts=search_opts) except Exception: self._more = False instances = [] exceptions.handle(self.request, _('Unable to retrieve instances.')) if instances: full_flavors = OrderedDict([(str(flavor.id), flavor) for flavor in flavors]) image_map = OrderedDict([(str(image.id), image) for image in images]) # Loop through instances to get flavor info. for instance in instances: if hasattr(instance, 'image'): # Instance from image returns dict if isinstance(instance.image, dict): if instance.image.get('id') in image_map: instance.image = image_map[instance.image['id']] try: flavor_id = instance.flavor["id"] if flavor_id in full_flavors: instance.full_flavor = full_flavors[flavor_id] else: # If the flavor_id is not in full_flavors list, # get it via nova api. instance.full_flavor = api.nova.flavor_get( self.request, flavor_id) except Exception: msg = ('Unable to retrieve flavor "%s" for instance "%s".' % (flavor_id, instance.id)) LOG.info(msg)

commit_message:
Image list function should normalize owner filter

The api.glance.image_list_detailed() function accepts a list of
filters which it then translates into a form that is acceptable for
Glance v1 or Glance v2. These translations included support for
mapping 'is_public' to 'visibility', but did not include support for
mapping 'property-owner_id' to 'owner'.

This changes adds support for mapping 'property-owner_id' to 'owner'
for Glance v2, and mapping 'owner' to 'property-owner_id' for Glance
v1.

Before this fix, "rebuild instance" from the instances page did not
properly list project-specific images as options.  After this fix,
"rebuild instance" is working as expected.

Change-Id: Ica750f8b36bdbadd02a81aed41fd250864a49a66
Closes-Bug: 1671693
(cherry picked from commit 445117eb1fa1cd67e21e69243fbbe12c453192fa)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/35/463335/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Glance v1 uses filter 'is_public' (True, False). # Glance v2 uses filter 'visibility' ('public', 'private', ...). # Glance v2: Replace 'is_public' with 'visibility'. # Glance v1: Replace 'visibility' with 'is_public'. del filters['visibility'] def _normalize_owner_id_filter(filters): if not filters: return # Glance v1 uses filter 'property-owner_id' (Project ID). # Glance v2 uses filter 'owner' (Project ID). if VERSIONS.active >= 2: if 'property-owner_id' in filters: # Glance v2: Replace 'property-owner_id' with 'owner'. filters['owner'] = filters['property-owner_id'] del filters['property-owner_id'] elif 'owner' in filters: # Glance v1: Replace 'owner' with 'property-owner_id'. filters['property-owner_id'] = filters['owner'] del filters['owner'] _normalize_owner_id_filter(filters)

commit_message:
Use more correct assert function

Replace 'assertFalse(a in b)' with 'assertNotIn(a, b)' and
replace 'assertTrue(a not in b)' with 'assertNotIn(a, b)'

Co-Authored-By: xujun <xu.jun@99cloud.net>
Change-Id: I608c04b292bf66d383d291e3529da9dad5f26576

commit_message:
[WIP] Support Domain Specific Role

In mitaka, keystone has the feature to manage closed roles
in domain by domain admin. This patch will support it.
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/keystone/+spec/domain-specific-roles

TODO
 - write test
 - implied role
 - relate domain roles to global roles

Change-Id: I176b9bd8c1845a305b165a80383a05653ec3ba6b

commit_message:
Only import wsgiref when needed

wsgiref is only used then server.py is called directly which is usually not the
case if monasca-api runs under a wsgi container.

Change-Id: I229ac6034107d087750179460153e1350aad314e

Pass package list as a list

This patch passes the list of packages to install as a list
rather then using the slower with_items.

commit_message:
Stop relying on dictutils

Change-Id: Ida27c6ae1f6b5e5cd9a763c596054ccda2f9a38f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/05/465005/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def flatten_dict_to_keypairs(d, separator=':'): """Generator that produces sequence of keypairs for nested dictionaries. :param d: dictionaries which may be nested :param separator: symbol between names """ for name, value in sorted(six.iteritems(d)): if isinstance(value, dict): for subname, subvalue in flatten_dict_to_keypairs(value, separator): yield ('%s%s%s' % (name, separator, subname), subvalue) else: yield name, value target = dict(flatten_dict_to_keypairs(d=target, separator='.'))
deleted_lines: from oslo_utils import dictutils target = dict(dictutils.flatten_dict_to_keypairs(d=target, separator='.'))

Cleanup block level environment vars

raised to the block level to avoid repetition and code clutter.

commit_message:
move mistral base action dependency to mistral_lib

mistral_lib base TripleoAction has a context in the run method
signature. These changes remove the mistral.context and make use
of the one provide by the default executor

Change-Id: Ib1a5aa8d5735b05f5308dc943ac088b5eeeec253
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/32/454632/18 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def run(self, context): oc = self.get_object_client(context) def run(self, context): swift = self.get_object_client(context) mistral = self.get_workflow_client(context) def run(self, context): swift = self.get_object_client(context) mistral = self.get_workflow_client(context) def run(self, context): oc = self.get_object_client(context) mc = self.get_workflow_client(context) def run(self, context): stack = self.get_orchestration_client(context).stacks.get(self.container) swift = self.get_object_client(context) mistral = self.get_workflow_client(context) def run(self, context): try: mc = self.get_workflow_client(context) oc = self.get_object_client(context) def run(self, context): swift = self.get_object_client(context) mistral = self.get_workflow_client(context)
deleted_lines: def run(self): oc = self.get_object_client() def run(self): swift = self.get_object_client() mistral = self.get_workflow_client() def run(self): swift = self.get_object_client() mistral = self.get_workflow_client() def run(self): oc = self.get_object_client() mc = self.get_workflow_client() def run(self): stack = self.get_orchestration_client().stacks.get(self.container) swift = self.get_object_client() mistral = self.get_workflow_client() def run(self): try: mc = self.get_workflow_client() oc = self.get_object_client() def run(self): swift = self.get_object_client() mistral = self.get_workflow_client()

commit_message:
Add SUSE support

Add support for SUSE based distributions. We also update the bindep.txt,
run_tests.sh, .gitignore, tests-repo-clone.sh and Vagrantfile files
from the openstack-ansible-tests repository.

Change-Id: I5a2b3cae0ed325abb3920e9a684d25898df6027d

subject: Fix role gate tests for Ansible 2.3
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-17 17:50:40.000000000', 'files': ['tests/inventory'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-repo_server/commit/08f937a5af93175c3733bcaa34c9e3dd1278e1a4', 'message': "Fix role gate tests for Ansible 2.3

'ansible_become' defined as a host_var or in the inventory for a host
has a higher precedence than 'become' defined within a playbook.

In change Id5b76a87809f03951c954fc3d752419a673403f7, 'become' was
defined explicitly for each play running against localhost so
'ansible_become' should be removed from its host_vars.

Change-Id: Ic74099b95342a938c77c08305230aeb711741b76
Cc: Jimmy McCrory <jimmy.mccrory@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix role gate tests for Ansible 2.3

'ansible_become' defined as a host_var or in the inventory for a host
has a higher precedence than 'become' defined within a playbook.

In change Id5b76a87809f03951c954fc3d752419a673403f7, 'become' was
defined explicitly for each play running against localhost so
'ansible_become' should be removed from its host_vars.

Change-Id: Ic74099b95342a938c77c08305230aeb711741b76
Cc: Jimmy McCrory <jimmy.mccrory@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-repo_server refs/changes/85/465685/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

need to document to raise confusion.

subject: Use physical utilisation for cached images
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-11 07:02:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/2e910e7bd0d5513cd0ce3f924834ed9088e041ab', 'message': 'Use physical utilisation for cached images

Because the VHD has a virtual size of 40GB when uploaded to glance,
but only a small amount of disk is used to create a snapshot of it.
So physical utilisation of all used VDIs should be counted for used
disk space.

commit_message:
Use physical utilisation for cached images

Since glance images are downloaded and snapshotted before they are used.
Only a small proportion of its VDI will be in use and it will never grow.
So the real disk usage for VDIs varies with their capability to expand.
Disks connected to VMs continue to use the virtual utilisation as they
are able to expand.

Change-Id: Ie7aae58a47e6651af5b609fb9abc13ab5d61e4df
Closes-bug: 1612057
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/62/353862/19 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: physical_used = sum([ int(session.xenapi.VDI.get_physical_utilisation(vdi_ref)) for vdi_ref in sr_rec["VDIs"]]) data["disk_used"] = physical_used data["disk_available"] = total - physical_used
deleted_lines: used = int(sr_rec["physical_utilisation"]) data["disk_used"] = used data["disk_available"] = total - used

commit_message:
Add ssh-keyscan to unblock kolla gate

As a change to remove puppet from infra nodepool,
ssh-keyscan is needed for each node [0]

Permissions to ssh/config file should be 600 instead
of current 664 [1]

Fix unit tests for missing fedora:
ValueError: Valid values are [centos, rhel, ubuntu, oraclelinux, debian], but found 'fedora'

Refs:
[0] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-April/116036.html
[1] http://logs.openstack.org/68/461368/1/check/gate-kolla-ansible-dsvm-deploy-centos-binary-centos-7-nv/0a94da7/console.html#_2017-05-01_12_06_08_440775

Closes-Bug: #1687408
Change-Id: I338e457fff35d8a28bd9f96e88dbb4ee55a47864
(cherry picked from commit 508f73e059fdfe8e051c58762dc8e21d826d54db)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/25/462025/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: chmod 600 /home/jenkins/.ssh/config ssh-keyscan "${ip}" >> ~/.ssh/known_hostshost_key_checking = False # Record the running state of the environment as seen by the setup module ansible all -i ${RAW_INVENTORY} -m setup > /tmp/logs/ansible/initial-setup
deleted_lines: # Record the running state of the environment as seen by the setup module ansible all -i ${RAW_INVENTORY} -m setup > /tmp/logs/ansible/initial-setup

commit_message:
modify test-requirement according to requirements project

the OpenStack requirements project has modify version requirement of docutils/sphinx.
The link is below
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/418772/
So modify test-requirement like other project
Closes-Bug: #1666149

Change-Id: Ia9dc8e16deded517b11a89e67569cdbd74c62534

commit_message:
Remove usage of WritableLogger from oslo.log

The class WritableLogger was deprecated since liberty, will be removed

subject: Check for test-requirements.txt file then install
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-18 07:58:47.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/tempest-jobs.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/fd378e5b9562f8292ac1ce1c82126801e2c8e640', 'message': 'Check for test-requirements.txt file then install

Some of the projects having tempest-plugin like aodh does not
have test-requirements.txt file which leds to the failure of
tempest-plugin-sanity job while installing test packages from

Change-Id: I09f2ab6d2187f159f7ddb0068111ac276ca7bbcf
'}]
commit_message:
Check for test-requirements.txt file then install

Some of the projects having tempest-plugin like aodh does not
have test-requirements.txt file which leds to the failure of
tempest-plugin-sanity job while installing test packages from
it. In order to avoid the failure we need to check for that
file then install.

Change-Id: I09f2ab6d2187f159f7ddb0068111ac276ca7bbcf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/59/465859/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Check for test-requirements.txt file in a project then install it. if [[ -e $WORKSPACE/openstack/$project/test-requirements.txt ]]; then $TVENV pip install -r $WORKSPACE/openstack/$project/test-requirements.txt fi

commit_message:
Run migration tests along scenario ones

Increase concurrency to two, and add compute migration tests, so
we can keep them running fine. A multinode environment is the
right place to run migration test.

Change-Id: Ib850dc0f8c73d0cba421777925c0619802fed3cc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/87/465487/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Run scenario and nova migration tests with concurrency 2 export DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_REGEX='(^tempest\.(scenario|api\.compute\.admin\.test_(live_|)migration))' export TEMPEST_CONCURRENCY=2

commit_message:
Update barbican gates from experimental to non-voting

The experimental barbican-dsvm-functional gates are passing,
let's upgrade from experimental to non-voting.  Also adds a non-voting
py35 dsvm-functional gate.

commit_message:
Python-barbicanclient functional gate changes

Unbreak python-barbicanclient gate ("enable_plugin barbican" in
DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG was removed here:
 Idd94b900b238c865a4074ec7d1f9c1c16ef8d434)

Also enables only tempest, rabbit, mysql, and key services, which should
make stacking faster anyway.

Change-Id: I95b5390ef24a754f66ccdb9ccde34cd0820b02fd

commit_message:
Configure AIDE before initial run

This patch ensures that AIDE is fully configured before the first
database initialization process begins.

Closes-Bug: 1686110
Change-Id: I209b88afb305828fa6e46de255ef11f5a6645427
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security refs/changes/19/459719/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(mhayden): CentOS/RHEL already provide a very strict AIDE configuration # that meets the requirements of V-72069 and V-72071. That config # is borrowed for Ubuntu 16.04 here. - name: Configure AIDE to verify additional properties blockinfile: dest: "{{ aide_conf }}" insertbefore: EOF marker: "# {mark} MANAGED BY OPENSTACK-ANSIBLE-SECURITY" block: "{{ lookup('file', 'aide_extra.conf') }}" when: - ansible_os_family | lower == 'ubuntu' tags: - low - aide - V-72069 - V-72071 - V-72073
deleted_lines: # NOTE(mhayden): CentOS/RHEL already provide a very strict AIDE configuration # that meets the requirements of V-72069 and V-72071. That config # is borrowed for Ubuntu 16.04 here. - name: Configure AIDE to verify additional properties blockinfile: dest: "{{ aide_conf }}" insertbefore: EOF marker: "# {mark} MANAGED BY OPENSTACK-ANSIBLE-SECURITY" block: "{{ lookup('file', 'aide_extra.conf') }}" when: - ansible_os_family | lower == 'ubuntu' tags: - low - aide - V-72069 - V-72071 - V-72073

commit_message:
Update documentation for Theme Preview panel

The enabled files for the Developer dashboard and Theme Preview
panel have been moved to contrib.

Added the step for copying enabled files to the local folder.

Change-Id: I3182aafd86e1ed1ba610d4b11bed81f8a65eb0e3
Closes-bug: #1691291
(cherry picked from commit 3cb953e1c70897d00b7d175fcd2de59385da2fdd)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/86/465586/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: `Theme Preview Panel`_.Theme Preview Panel =================== The Bootstrap Theme Preview panel contains examples of all stock Bootstrap markup with the currently applied theme, as well as source code for replicating them; click the ``</>`` symbol when hovering over a component. To enable the Developer dashboard with the Theme Preview panel: #. Set :ref:`DEBUG <debug_setting>` setting to ``True``. #. Copy ``_9001_developer.py`` and ``_9010_preview.py`` from ``openstack_dashboard/contrib/developer/enabled/`` to ``openstack_dashboard/local/enabled/``. #. Restart the web server.
deleted_lines: `Theme Preview Page`_.Theme Preview Page ================== When the :ref:`DEBUG <debug_setting>` setting is set to ``True``, the Developer dashboard will be present in Horizon's side nav. The Bootstrap Theme Preview panel contains examples of all stock Bootstrap markup with the currently applied theme, as well as source code for replicating them; click the ``</>`` symbol when hovering over a component.

commit_message:
Add angular system information panel

Adding a new panel to admin dashboard that will use angular js
instead of the django templates. Includes all of the functionality
found in the existing system information panel.

Set DISABLED = False in
openstack_dashboard/enabled/_2141_admin_ng_info_panel.py

Co-Authored-By: Kristine Brown <kbrown@thoughtworks.com>
Co-Authored-By: Rajat Vig <rajatv@thoughtworks.com>
Co-Authored-By: Dan Siwiec <dan.siwiec@thoughtworks.com>

Change-Id: Ic7f671ca871bf925c1fd441129ace0f93a8a5d3a
Partially-Implements: blueprint ng-system-information
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/31/204731/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. # The slug of the panel to be added to HORIZON_CONFIG. Required. PANEL = 'nginfo' # The slug of the dashboard the PANEL associated with. Required. PANEL_DASHBOARD = 'admin' # The slug of the panel group the PANEL is associated with. PANEL_GROUP = 'admin' DISABLED = True # Python panel class of the PANEL to be added. ADD_PANEL = \ ('openstack_dashboard.dashboards.admin.nginfo.panel.NGInfo')

subject: Update to support the ovdsbapp 0.4.0 API
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-15 17:42:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/0a5429a909d72d391fed31187279996e6d08d40a', 'message': "Update to match ovdsbapp 0.4.0 API

idl_factory was removed in favor of just passing in an Idl instance

commit_message:
Update to support the ovdsbapp 0.4.0 API

idl_factory was removed in favor of just passing in an Idl instance
as an Idl doesn't start a connection until its .run() is called.

The try/excepts will be removed when the ovsdbapp 0.4.0 constraint
changes are merged.

Change-Id: Id22faa1f6179c2fdf8a136972d65f10749c9fc2e

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/97/459197/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - Supports string type of property 'networks' of OS::Nova::Server. Two values are allowed: 'auto' and 'none'. 'auto' means either a network that is already available to the project will be used, or if one does not exist, will be automatically created for the project; 'none' means no networking will be allocated for the created server. And this requires nova api version equal or greater than 2.37 and the ``auto-allocated-topology`` API is available in the Neutron networking service.

subject: Fix a filter error in images panel.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-18 06:53:05.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/images.module.js'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/d884143ce37186cbe9e62a64fe06ed9e38f34ed2', 'message': 'Fix a filter error in images panel.

In images panel, I set the filter to be "visibility: unknown",
then an error appeared at top right corner of the page:
"Error: Unable to retrieve the images."

I open the developer tool of browser, I found an error response
in the network tab:
"Invalid visibility value: unknown".

The possible values for image visibility includes public, private,
shared and community, so I fixed it in the filter.

Change-Id: I48fc32ed37ac1c8ef36d0a0b8c05082c649a8534
Closes-Bug: #1691669
'}]
commit_message:
Fix a filter error in images panel.

In images panel, I set the filter to be "visibility: unknown",
then an error appeared at top right corner of the page:
"Error: Unable to retrieve the images."

I open the developer tool of browser, I found an error response
in the network tab:
"Invalid visibility value: unknown".

The possible values for image visibility includes public, private,
shared and community, so I fixed it in the filter.

Change-Id: I48fc32ed37ac1c8ef36d0a0b8c05082c649a8534
Closes-Bug: #1691669

commit_message:
Libvirt support for tagged volume attachment

This patch adds support for tagged volume attachment to the libvirt
driver.

Change-Id: I8b475992b881db08cf1354299cc86042413074cc
Implements: blueprint bp/virt-device-tagged-attach-detach

commit_message:
Allow fip associate to different tenant port if admin

Admin users should be able to associate a fip to a port owned by a
different project.

This would allow services like Octavia (with the WIP FLIP driver) to
utilize a tenant's FIP without taking ownership of it. They can pass the
FIP ID to the API and the service can bind it, but the tenant still owns
their FIP and doesn't "lose" the FIP in the process.

Change-Id: I873ac98e2d275fb435983ca3d652960ca5b715ca

commit_message:
Mark the default policy usage for neutron resource

The default policy usage of some neutron resources
is limited to administrators only. This change will
add the docstring and resource type policy for
the resources:
OS::Neutron::ProviderNet
OS::Neutron::Segment

Change-Id: Ia8c0bf1d0ceaf92416539ffba7ee85c6aa50e256
Closes-Bug: #1690328
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/10/465210/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Libvirt support for tagged nic attachment

This patch adds support for tagged network interface attachment to the
libvirt driver.

Change-Id: Ib86b2b8a5e784e998da930d3f48b6bc64aead6c3
Implements: blueprint virt-device-tagged-attach-detach
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/20/415520/31 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(artom) Rebuild the device metadata here in case the attached # volume was tagged. This is not terribly efficient, but it avoids # the upper layers having to call the driver through RPC, # especially since the code path from attach_volume in the compute # api is pretty convoluted instance.device_metadata = self._build_device_metadata( context, instance) instance.save() def attach_interface(self, context, instance, image_meta, vif, tag=None): if tag: instance.device_metadata = self._build_device_metadata( context, instance) instance.save() tagged_bdms = {bdm.volume_id: bdm for bdm in bdms if bdm.tag} bdm = tagged_bdms.get(dev.serial)
deleted_lines: def attach_interface(self, context, instance, image_meta, vif): tagged_bdms = {_get_device_name(bdm): bdm for bdm in bdms if bdm.tag} bdm = tagged_bdms.get(dev.target_dev)

commit_message:
Use subnet id to allocate floating IP in Admin panel

In the admin allocate floating IP form, the pool select display
the subnet cidr info, which should be used subnet id when creating a
floating IP. This patch fix it.

Change-Id: I4f12027c90e580824d74b10010bf799515920702
Closes-Bug: #1689230
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/56/463356/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: subnet = api.neutron.subnet_get(request, data['pool']) param['subnet_id'] = subnet.id pool=subnet.network_id,
deleted_lines: # TODO(liuyulong): use subnet id to allocate floating IP. pool=data['pool'],

commit_message:
operation_log: Honor settings parameters

Previously 'format' and 'mask_fields' in OPERATION_LOG_OPTIONS
were completely ignored. OPERATION_LOG_OPTIONS is a dict, but
the logic tried to get attributes, so these options were ignored.

Change-Id: Ide4826ebf74218873a81b67aaa0dd817c4798702
Closes-Bug: #1675176
(cherry picked from commit fdb21222b6061c1b42298a9c7d3380a8df6e837a)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/24/462224/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Image list function should normalize owner filter
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-08 13:58:37.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/api/glance.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/aab378b6272eeab10280c3ae02fc5a426b6285ca', 'message': 'Image list function should normalize owner filter

The api.glance.image_list_detailed() function accepts a list of
filters which it then translates into a form that is acceptable for
Glance v1 or Glance v2. These translations included support for
mapping 'is_public' to 'visibility', but did not include support for
mapping 'property-owner_id' to 'owner'.

This changes adds support for mapping 'property-owner_id' to 'owner'
for Glance v2, and mapping 'owner' to 'property-owner_id' for Glance

Before this fix, "rebuild instance" from the instances page did not

commit_message:
Image list function should normalize owner filter

The api.glance.image_list_detailed() function accepts a list of
filters which it then translates into a form that is acceptable for
Glance v1 or Glance v2. These translations included support for
mapping 'is_public' to 'visibility', but did not include support for
mapping 'property-owner_id' to 'owner'.

This changes adds support for mapping 'property-owner_id' to 'owner'
for Glance v2, and mapping 'owner' to 'property-owner_id' for Glance
v1.

Before this fix, "rebuild instance" from the instances page did not
properly list project-specific images as options.  After this fix,
"rebuild instance" is working as expected.

Change-Id: Ica750f8b36bdbadd02a81aed41fd250864a49a66
Closes-Bug: 1671693
(cherry picked from commit 445117eb1fa1cd67e21e69243fbbe12c453192fa)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/34/463334/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Glance v1 uses filter 'is_public' (True, False). # Glance v2 uses filter 'visibility' ('public', 'private', ...). # Glance v2: Replace 'is_public' with 'visibility'. # Glance v1: Replace 'visibility' with 'is_public'. del filters['visibility'] def _normalize_owner_id_filter(filters): if not filters: return # Glance v1 uses filter 'property-owner_id' (Project ID). # Glance v2 uses filter 'owner' (Project ID). if VERSIONS.active >= 2: if 'property-owner_id' in filters: # Glance v2: Replace 'property-owner_id' with 'owner'. filters['owner'] = filters['property-owner_id'] del filters['property-owner_id'] elif 'owner' in filters: # Glance v1: Replace 'owner' with 'property-owner_id'. filters['property-owner_id'] = filters['owner'] del filters['owner'] _normalize_owner_id_filter(filters)
